According to NHK television, the approximately 19,000 workers who will be dismissed are about 15 percent of the Japanese company's workforce. Nissan, in which the French group Renault holds a 35 percent participation, is expected to publish on Tuesday the results for fiscal year of 2024-2025 finished in March. item.title: Macau maintains shipping by air to the United States
item.description: The Macau Post Office Director told Lusa yesterday that, unlike neighboring Hong Kong, the region kept ordering orders to the United States (USA), but only by air. On May 2, the US government eliminated the exemption of customs rights on small orders from mainland China and Hong Kong, such as those sent by the giants of Electronic Trade Shein and Temu. "In practice, now Macau is not included and the mail [which] goes to the United States is walking, except maritime. The rest, we keep normal," said Derby Lau Wai Meng. The Director of Post and Telecommunications Services (CTT) explained that the shipping of any goods, from sea to the US, implies a passage through Hong Kong, one of the busiest ports in the world. That is, there is only the hypothesis of sending orders by air, confirmed Derby Lau. "This case is sensitive," admitted the leader. "I think it's better not to talk [this subject], because the best thing is not to remember us," he added. Trump in Action The end of the exemption of customs rights on small orders from mainland China and Hong Kong emerged in an executive order, signed by US President Donald Trump on April 2. The document asked the US Secretary of Commerce, Howard Lutnick, to submit a report, within 90 days, if the end of the exemption should also cover Macao, "to avoid escape to these measures." On April 16, Hong Kong's post office announced the suspension of sending orders to the United States in response to the imposition, "abusive", tariffs by US authorities. A presidential decree issued by Donald Trump, still in the first term, in 2020, eliminated the preferential treatment granted to Hong Kong. The ancient British colony is therefore also affected by the 145 percent surcharge imposed on China. Chinese Communist Party's main official for Hong Kong and Macao affairs and governments of both regions accused the United States of imposing tariffs in mid -April to sabotage China. Macao Executive leader Sam Hou Fai criticized the United States for the “abusive imposition of customs taxes on all his business partners,” including China, “under various pretexts”. Yesterday, the US representative for the United States, Jamieson Greer, said Washington and Beijing will suspend the majority of customs rights and negotiate for 90 days. In the negotiations made in Geneva, the United States and China agreed to reduce the reciprocal customs rights imposed on each other, passing Chinese imports to pay a 30 percent customs right, while US products will pay a 10 percent customs right.

item.title: Venice receives “Parallel Worlds”, from Macao, at the Architecture Biennial
item.description: It was inaugurated last Thursday, in Venice, at the 19th Biennial of Architecture, the show “Parallels”, which represents Macao at the Biennial and which is a project carried out by photographer Iwan Baan with architectural students at the University of St. Joseph (USJ). The curatorship is still with Wang Shu, the last Pritzker award, and Lu Wenyu. This is a show that reveals the coexistence of “parallel worlds” in Macao, combining “Macao urban landscape images captured by the famous humanistic architecture photographer Iwan Baan and facilities created by teachers and students from the Faculty of Architecture of the China Academy of Arts and the Faculty of Architecture and Design at the University of São José de Macao”. Thus, it is represented “the urban fabric of the city where Chinese and Western cultures, old and new styles have coexisting for over 400 years,” says a note from the Cultural Institute (IC). There are, in this show, four “parallel worlds”, namely “the deep space of the historic city, the hotel architecture that embodies the merger between East and West, the geometric order of the modern city, representing its vibrant development; and the future projection of a digitized and intangible city, which defines an innovative view for Macau”. Reveal the heritage According to the IC, "through aerial photography and a unique perspective, Iwan Baan demonstrated the relationship between architecture, urban landscape and the natural environment of Macau, being highly engaging and narrative." "Young people from the colleges of architecture in the interior of China and Macao brought to the exhibition several creative facilities that provide ideas for the future development of Macao's urban architecture." Leong Wai Man, president of the IC, said in his speech in Venice that "world cultural heritage focused on the historic center of Macau and the modern buildings around the city show the harmony between the past and the present, constituting a vivid representation of the integration of Chinese and Western cultures," this exposure in Venice "reflects exactly the precious cultural content of Macau." The exhibition “Parallel Worlds” can be seen until November 23 this year at Arsenale, Campo Della Tana, Castello 2126/A, 30122, in Venice.

item.title: History | Launched Chinese edition of the book by Manuel V. Basilio
item.description:
It's called “Stories and Memories-Baixo do Monte and surroundings”, it is a book by Manuel V. Basilio and its edition in Chinese will be released on May 19 at the headquarters of the Macao Retired, Retired and Pensioners Association (Apomac). The work, presented in 2023, now wins a new version and has a preface by Lok Po, director of the newspaper or Mun
It will be released next Monday, 19, the Chinese edition of another book by Manuel V. Basil, a retired teacher who has been dedicated to various investigations into the history of Macau. This time, this is the book “Stories and Memories-Baixo do Mount and surroundings”, already presented in its Portuguese version in 2023, and now has preface by Lok Po, director of the newspaper or Mun. The launch runs at the headquarters of Apomac - Macao's Retired, Retired and Pensioners Association. According to a statement from Apomac, since the first launch of the work that “several people encouraged the author to also edit a Chinese language version, given the interest that may be with the Chinese community in the dissemination of one of the most striking periods in the history of Macao - the integration of the Chinese population in the so -called 'Christian city'”, when the effective miscegenation of western and eastern crops created the barrier created by the old wall and doors of the city, all living in harmony as neighbors ”. We were in the mid -nineteenth century. More specifically, from 1844, the Portuguese administration "authorized all foreigners to buy or build houses and have any terrain in Macao." Thus, "this measure eventually favored years later, the Chinese traders who had some wealth and came to Macao from southern China to escape the Taiping rebellion, also known as the Taiping Civil War, which lasted from 1850 to 1864, having settled here and restarts their activities as entrepreneurs."
According to the same note, the end of the separation between the so -called Christian city and the zone in which the Chinese community lived was thanks “to the end of the coexistence of two jurisdictions in the Macao Peninsula - the Portuguese and the Chinese, respectively, inside and outside the city's wall that, over centuries, separated the two communities”. It was also fundamental for this new phase “the beginning of the so -called colonial period, in which the Portuguese government had territorial autonomy throughout the peninsula to the door door, which later became known as the siege door”. Election zones Where did the Chinese were installed when the end of this separation between communities and modes of life? The book describes that "one of the zones preferred by the Chinese traders to reside was precisely the one that was then designated by low of the mount, because it is near the heart of the city." "Since then some names of public roads have changed by the desire of their residents. Do you know, by chance, the old name of Travessa dos Anjos? And the reasons why it was changed, and what was the old method used to give names to public roads? Did you know that some Chinese were also awarded with honorific titles by the Portuguese court, and that these titles had an expiration date for one or two lives?" in the note. To all these curiosities and historical facts the book of Manuel V. Basilio intends to respond. In the case of Baixa do Monte, and according to the information available in the “register of public roads and other places of the city of Macau, 1957, it was a designation for“ the southern hill slope and covering an entire area, vaguely defined, ranging from Fortaleza to the nearby streets of Palha, S. Domingos and Pedro Nolasco da Silva, between Rua de S. Paulo and Calçada do Monte ”. This was an area “where many Portuguese and macanese families lived”, and to prove this fact, Manuel V. Basil “collected data on several families, especially macanese, who resided in that city from the mid -nineteenth century to the second half of the twentieth century, and whose collection includes, in particular, Baptist, Baptist, Valoma, Marques, Xavier families, Crestejo, medicines, Lopes, Morais, Nogueira, Simões, Cameirão, Costa, Silva, Fernandes, Souza, Pires, Gonçalves, Jorge, Eusébio, Placé, Osório, Santos, Rosario and Martins ”. From 1963, there are families who lived in blocks 3 and 4 of “Kwok Wá Tai Há”, ie “Capitol neighborhood”, next to the sidewalk of truths, and “formed, for decades, an authentic community neighborhood of Macanese”. Currently "just a few macanese reside there." Biographies and titles But not only of streets speaks this book. The author also wrote summarized biographies of some individuals and Chinese traders who lived in downtown Mount, namely Chou Iau and Fong Seng, who, in 1880, were awarded the title of Knight by the honorary mercy of King D. Luís I of Portugal, due to the valuable contributions they made to Macau's economic and social life. The author also makes a brief description of the divinity on the Tcha, the temple dedicated to him, along with the sidewalk of truths, as well as the festivities in his honor that are held annually on the 18th day of the fifth month of the lunar calendar. It also makes a brief summary of the history of some buildings that existed and others that still exist, located in the boundary zone of Baixa do Monte, including the Capitol Theater building, since its inauguration, on April 18, 1931 until its closing, on August 1, 1987, and its later requalification, which became the “Capitol Theater Shopping Center”. Thus, “Stories and Memories - Baixa do Mount and surroundings” includes “Memories, Experiences, Uses and Customs, as well as stories based on the history of Macao”, as well as valuable information about the toponymy of some Macao zones and their history.

item.title: Church | Stability in local Christian communities
item.description:
Robert Francis Prevost was chosen for days as the new leader of the Catholic Church, having adopted the name of Leo XIV. HM has heard two analysts on any impacts on the functioning of dioceses in Macau and Hong Kong and what is expected is continuity and stability, such as a peaceful relationship with Beijing
Only two days lasted the choice of a new Pope after Francis' death. Leo XIV, born Robert Francisc Prevost in Chicago, USA, was the choice of Vatican's conclave cardinals. HM spoke to two analysts to try to understand any impacts or changes in the functioning of the Catholic Church on the dioceses of Macau and Hong Kong, but the course seems to be that of stability. “I don't think there will be nothing concrete. The situation in Hong Kong and Macau is quite well understood and stable. I know that Catholics and people of good will in both places will be praying and wishing Pope Lion all graces, blessings and successes in their pontificate,” said Stephen Morgan, Rector of the University of St. Joseph (USJ). Already Peter Stilwell, who preceded Morgan in the rectory of USJ and is currently director of the Department of Ecumenical Relations and Interreligious Dialogue of Patriarchate of Lisbon, argues that "the relationship of Hong Kong and Macao with mainland China [regarding religion] is determined by the 90s agreements." “What will happen, at the end of the 50 years planned for the transition, will depend on many variables in a world and in a country (China) in very quick transformation. However, the Holy See has established with both dioceses [from Macau and Hong Kong] a relationship that maintains them outside any episcopal conference and in a direct relationship with Rome. To answer 'no'. However, the evolution of the agreement as Beijing, about the appointment of the Catholic bishops to the dioceses of mainland China, will be an important factor to observe, ”noted Peter Stilwell. He also added that "those interested in this evolution, however, will be closely observed how Pope Leo XIV Restructure, or not, the Vatican Secretariat of State - namely, the team that directly accompanies the Dossier of China." Ancient relationship Asked about the Vatican State relationship with Beijing with Leo XIV in power, the former USJ rector also does not foresee major changes. "The relationship will continue, discreet, but persistent, as so far. Contact has a 400 -year story, and we should not reduce it to the recent agreement on bishops." It is an agreement that "takes place between two entities with millennial memory, which think in terms of decades and centuries." "The fact that the new Pope is US nationality will be irrelevant. As head of state, his nationality is now from the Vatican City; and the daily interpeairs to which he will respond will have the perspective of a religious community that today extends to virtually every country in the world," said Peter Stilwell. Stephen Morgan believes that Roberto Prevost's choice for Pope has nothing to do with Trump's presence at the White House or political moves in the face of the China-Use relationship. "His election will have more to do with the fact that he is familiar with the situation of Catholics in the developing world and having had a few years of experience in Roman Courier, where he has established himself as a pair of safe hands he thinks for himself and hears broadly." Robert Prevost was brought to the Vatican by Pope Francis in 2023 to be responsible for examining the nominations of bishops around the world, one of the most important works of the Catholic Church, thus gaining prominence in the conclave.

item.title: Tourism | Andy Wu says concerts are not enough to attract visitors
item.description:
The government says it wants to bet on the organization of large -scale shows to streamline the economy in neighborhoods with less tourism, but Andy Wu, a tourism -related associative leader, says that this is not enough, defending the sale of tickets with associated discounts to take more people to consume in the territory
It is not music for the ears of tourism. In the view of Andy Wu, president of the Macao Tourist Industry Association, it is not enough to perform major shows in Macau, namely concerts, to increase the number of consumers in the community neighborhoods, that is, who are further away from sights. According to the newspaper or Mun, Andy Wu argued that complementary measures are needed to perform the concerts, namely the sale of tickets combined with associated discounts in local stores, so that people who go to the concert can also consume before the shows. Regarding the night economy, in bars and nightclubs, Andy Wu has stated that it still cannot be attractive enough for tourists, so it is important to have complementary measures to concerts. The government said that it is negotiating with ticket sales platforms a partnership to have ticket packages with discounts in stores, which should be a reality in the second half of the year, following many visitors from the interior of China to watch concerts or sports competitions in Macao. About the discount model to adopt, Andy Wu argued that one can take into account the format of the consumer award for the currently underway community zones, which would allow visitors to use coupons in local commerce. This would be more suitable than leading tourists to consume only in stores adhering to the discount program, he said. Be effective Given the negotiations carried out by the executive, Andy Wu referred to the newspaper to expect these partnerships to be launched in due time, namely in June, when the second large concert was held at Cotai, in the outdoor shows, near the Grand Lisboa Palace venture. Andy Wu has not yet forgotten public transport factor, essential for tourists to have better access to community neighborhoods before and after the shows. The suggestion of experimental creation of exclusive buses, of the genus Shuttle-Bus, was made, with concrete paths between the shows zone and the community neighborhoods, so that visitors move to less known neighborhoods in Macau during the day and see the show at night.

item.title: Game | Criticized opacity in alternative investments
item.description:
Ron Lam accuses the government of “acting on the closed door” compared to investments of 130 billion patacas that concessionaires will spend over 10 years to revitalize the city. Without public budgets, plans and calendar, the deputy understands that society is removed from projects
As established in the new game concession contracts, the operators made a commitment to contribute 130 billion Patacas over the 10 years of concession in non-game investments. The measure expected to print “vitality” to the city and stimulate local economic development has passed along with the population and various social sectors, from the optics of Ron Lam. At today's plenary session of responses to oral interpeairs, the deputy will ask the government what measures will promote to increase the transparency of these projects, both at the budget level, but also on plans and execution calendar. According to the interpellation released yesterday by the deputy's office, "society still knows nothing about the calendar of these plans and the form of its realization." Giving as an example the International Parade of Macao, in which the Cultural Institute said it did not assume expenses due to “narrower cooperation with leisure companies this year,” Ron Lam criticizes the lack of transparency of authorities who argued that it was not “convenient to disclose the budget value, as it involved investments from private companies”. Since investments result from commitments made in public contracts, “the use and situation of the respective budget must be treated equivalent to that of the public purse”, argues Ron Lam. The deputy accuses the government of being “acting on the closed door”, without prior, interchange and subsequent inspection of society on non-game investments. In fact, Ron Lam indicates that investments, which on average exceed 10 billion patacas per year, "have become a government's private portfolio for their plans and activities." Given its nature, the legislator understands that they should follow the rules of public services, fully public capital companies and public capital companies with dominant influence, being obliged to fully publish information related to the capital involved. Returning to the case of the Macao International Parade, Ron Lam asks what law the government was based on “to escape public law to information about non-game investments”. The larger In view of the scenario set, Ron Lam asks if the executive will define mechanisms that guarantee the disclosure of data on the investments of the dealers, as well as the situation of the execution of the projects. The deputy also asks which “the service responsible for the supervision and implementation of the non-game plans of the six concessionaires, by evaluating the performance of the respective investments” and whether there is a sanctioning regime if the results did not meet expectations. Ron Lam takes the opportunity to underline the employment situation of residents and non-residents hired by the concessionaires, denouncing the dismissal of "veteran workers who have not made mistakes, without offering them any job change option." In addition, it states that participating workers in the “specific employment + training plans” were failed to be just cause, and that residents looking for full -time employment at dealers were eventually in part time, after not being hired after employment interviews. For Ron Lam, this situation reflects the position of residents as “complement of the labor imported from the game dealers”.

item.title: AL | Xia says that relationship with executive differs from separation of powers
item.description:
At a meeting with the deputies, the Director of the Office for Hong Kong and Macao affairs to the Council of State stated that the relationship between the Executive and the Legislative Assembly is different from the concept of separation of powers from the “West”. Xia Baolong characterized the relationship as a collaboration with the predominance of the executive branch
Hong Kong and Macau's workst a director of the China Communist Party Central Committee and Director of the Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office with the Council of State, Xia Baolong, went to the Legislative Assembly (AL) on Sunday for an ideas exchange with all the plenary deputies. During the meeting, Xia Baolong will have stated that "the way basic law regulates the relationship between the executive and legislative powers is not the same relationship that exists in the separation of powers used by the" West "," said the president of AL. Since the beginning of his passage through Macao, and like previous visits, Xia Baolong is quoted by guardians of high government positions and, in this case, by Kou Hoi In and some deputies. In statements cited by the Chinese channel of Rádio Macau, the president of AL indicated that Xia Baolong had binded the government's ancestry in relation to the House of Laws. “[The Director] said we have to further reinforce and optimize the relationship between the executive and legislative powers. The two parties need respect and mutual support so that we can benefit and develop the particularity of our political system to be characterized by the predominance of the executive power,” said Kou Hoi In. It should be noted that in no article of the basic law of the MSAR, or even the annex that regulates the methodology for the constitution of the AL, the predominance of the Executive Power is indicated in the face of the Legislative Power. In fact, Article 71 of the Basic Law establishes the possibility of the Legislative Assembly approving a motion of censorship “accusing the chief executive of serious violation of the law or abandonment of his duties”. In addition, despite having powers to dissolve the Legislative Assembly, article 54 of the Basic Law indicates two situations of conflict with the Legislative Power that may result in the resignation of the position of the Chief Executive. Roll During the meeting with the deputies, Xia Baolong praised the legislative work, in particular the revisions of laws related to national security, electoral laws and the legislation related to the game sector. Cooperation with Hengqin was one of the most discussed topics, with deputies and the director to agree on the need to reinforce integration between the two territories. The director pointed out that it is necessary to be aware of and prepared “for adversities, do the work of accelerating hengqin-macau integration and the proper diversification of the economy of Macau, and take another step in optimizing the relationship between executive branch and legislature, in the sense of respect and mutual support, to enhance the institutional advantages of the executive branch's predominance. According to a statement released yesterday by AL, the director expressed the desire that Macao, while “Pearl in the palm of the hand” of the homeland, will brush more sickly. Tariffs | Appeal to the determination of local companies Hong Kong and Macau's workst a director of the China Communist Party Central Committee and Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office Director with the Council of State, Xia Baolong, gathered yesterday with more than 20 representatives of the business sector. In a meeting that lasted more than two hours, the official left words of encouragement and resilience to the adversities caused by the trade war. According to the chairman of the Board of Directors of the Nam Kwong Group, Fu Jianguo, the director presented four specific requirements for the business community of Macao. Firstly, the need to have a spirit of struggle and face the current geopolitical situation at a higher level. Xia Baolong also asked entrepreneurs to have confidence in medium and long term national plans and tell the stories of China, Hong Kong and Macao well. The president of the Macao Banks Association and president of the Bank of China's Macao branch, Jia Tianbing, said that Xia Baolong will have made hope that Macau will overcome the difficulties of economic development.

item.title: MGM Theater | Symphonic concert about Disney's movie “Frozen” at the end of the month
item.description:
The MGM Theater welcomes, on May 31st and June 1st, the Symphonic Concert entirely dedicated to the Disney animation movie “Frozen”, thinking about World Children's Day, which is celebrated precisely on the first day of June. The song is in charge of the Macau Orchestra
The smallest and fans of Disney's movie "Frozen" will have the opportunity to see and hear a concert entirely to the history and characters of this production, being an initiative to celebrate World Children's Day, the ephemeris celebrated on June 1. The concert, welcomed by the MGM Theater on May 31st and June 1, takes place, respectively, at 20h and 15h. With co-organization of the Cultural Institute (IC), it is, according to a note of this organism, with “a charming and fantastic concert that will combine live symphonic music with scenic technology, bringing adult children and friends from Macao to the magical cold world”. The sound is in charge of the Macau Orchestra (OM), which will play live “various iconic songs from the animation soundtrack, synchronized with images projects on a giant 900 square meter and 28 million pixels, installed in the theater, with the 19.1-channel 19.1-channel sound system”. Thus, with the use of technology, the “fusion of sound and image will create an immersive experience that transports viewers to a fascinating ice and snow kingdom”, verifying “the excellence of international level and international level” in the space chosen for both shows, the MGM Theater. According to the IC note, this show room was officially recognized by Disney as a space to perform Disney concerts in Macao. Voices and Folding The concert has a “cast of excellence, bringing together musicians and top singers from Macao and abroad”, being directed by OM assistant conductor Tony Cheng-Te Yeh. The songs of the animation will be played by OM and several “international renowned singers”, such as Alyssa Fox, who played Elsa in the American tour of the Broadway musical “Frozen”; Ray Liu, who folds and sings Anna's voice in the Mandarin version of the animation, RJ Woessner, who gives life to the characters Kristoff and Hans and, CJ Tan as Olaf, as well as the Vocal Vocal Vocal Band group. item.title: Tariffs | Gold falls more than 3 % after agreement between Washington and Beijing
item.description: Gold, asset of safe haven in times of uncertainty, fell strongly yesterday, more than 3 percent, endangering the level of $ 3,200, after the United States and China announced a trade agreement. At 11:00 in Lisbon, the price of gold went down 3.23 percent to $ 3,217.58, although after the announcement of that agreement, a few minutes after 8:00 am, it fell even more pronounced to 3,216.29 dollars. And this after the US and China announced a reduction in tariffs. Specifically, Chinese tariffs will go from 125 percent to 10 percent over US products in the next 90 days. The US will do the same from 145 percent to 30 percent over Chinese products, as part of the terms agreed over the weekend to lock the new trade war this year. The tariff reductions agreed by China and the US will take effect on May 14. The above agreement between the two main commercial powers drives the dollar, affecting metal prices in general. Gold also descends with the reduction of geopolitical tensions, following the ceasefire agreed between India and Pakistan, while Russia and Ukraine can meet Thursday in Istanbul to start a diplomatic way to resolve the conflict. With yesterday's fall, gold is moving away from the current historical maximum of $ 3,414.65, checked on April 21.

item.title: Today Macau
item.description: Nissan automotive construction will suppress more than 10,000 jobs around the world, in addition to the nine thousand already announced in November, several Japanese social communication agencies yesterday reported. According to NHK television, the approximately 19,000 workers who will be dismissed are about 15 percent of the Japanese company's workforce. The automobile group was deemed to confirm this information, which was also released by the Diário Económico Nikkei. Nissan, in which the French group Renault holds a 35 percent participation, is expected to publish on Tuesday the results for fiscal year of 2024-2025 finished in March. Nissan is expected to announce a record annual loss in a context of restructuring the company and after the application of more tariffs by the United States. By the end of April, the automotive group had already foreseen net losses between 700 and 750 billion yen (between 4.32 and 4.62 billion euros) in the fiscal year of 2024-2025, about nine times more than it foresaw in February. The damage is explained, in particular, “by the costs associated with the ongoing relaunch plan,” said the automotive builder at the end of April. Given the persistence of the slowdown of sales in their main markets - the American and the Chinese - Nissan announced in early November that it intended to suppress 9,000 jobs worldwide and reduce its production capacity by 20 percent.

item.title: ANA CRISTINA ALVES
item.description: Ana Cristina Alves, auxiliary researcher and coordinator of the Educational Service of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center May 2025 In Chinese Proverbial Lessons I went to discover great affinities between spontaneous Chinese popular philosophy, which runs from mouth to mouth, and the Christian proverbial wisdom, also made so that believers, in every corner of the globe, could memorize, repeat and disseminate. Nothing like the other's knowledge to bring and dispel prejudice, being one of the most usual that Chinese are extremely pragmatic and cold. But when we come across proverbs such as “love others as yourself,” in a direct translation and faithful to the original “爱人如己” (ài Rú Rú Jǐ), such leads us to think twice, it seems not to be here just a matter of respect, uncharged and formal, but rather a strong feeling for the other, not any, only a deep affection, of those we understand well that we are good, we will be well, we will be well, we will be well, we will be better. Then he runs a love of the Christian way for China without Christ ever been. Such finding can lead us to the assumption of the existence of universal structures, not only logical, including as regards affections, therefore sentimental. After all, selfishness may not be a dominant tendency, there is everything: selfish, aggressive and competitive people, as others will be naturally altruistic, compassionate and cooperatives, ready to recognize the universality of the feeling of love, which crosses borders rather than erecting them, bringing people closer to the most diverse social classes, ethnic groups, geographies, as in "love has no borders", in a direct translation "" (Àiqíng wú jiējí zhī fēn), here is particularly emphasized social borders. The content of the message gains full sense when one realizes that love to oneself takes place in a culture that many consider wrong and prejudiced only to focus on the whole, in the community. Attention to the person, the particular and the style and feeling of each, lives, in philosophies such as Taoist for centuries with the valorization of the collectivity, this ultimate tendency manifestly inculcated and worked by Confucianism. Love to itself, care for the individual body and mind, is emphasized in the so -called Proverbial “well -understood love and virtue must begin with us”, which has the following correspondence in Chinese “爱德从己起” (to Cong Jǐ qǐ). Anyone who imagines that in proverbial wisdom there is only place to praise and sing relational love, since the Chinese do not have any religious philosophy that chants spiritual love above all, in the Christian way of St. Augustine, will be surprised to find the following proverb "where there is no other gentleman", that in a direct translation of the Chinese is "the love above all" 爱情至上 爱情至上 爱情至上ZHì Shàng). If in doubt, there is another saying of complementary meaning and in which the idea of ​​the integrity and unity of this powerful affection, which moves mountains in the Christian sense, when it reads 爱情专一 （（（（iqíng zhuān yī）, in a possible translation "love cannot be broken", "one person cannot have a heart in two parts at the same time." From a psychological point of view, the acceptance of the other in loving terms will have to be complete, so their tastes, affections, relationships, and objects cannot be rejected, as is clear from the lesson "Who loves Beltrão, loves their dog", in a relative correspondence for "爱屋及乌" (ài wū jí wū), which in a literal translation would be "love the house and the crums." As is well known, proverbs are susceptible to various interpretations, so they say polysemic, but if they are perspective as a whole, and only then as pieces of a puzzle, there seems to be many doubts with regard to the proverb philosophy and psychology of Chinese love, which is echoed in the country's scholarly philosophies. In Chapter 67 of the Book of the road and virtue (《道德经》), also known by the name of the Patriarch of Taoism, Lazi (老子), is the first of the three guiding virtues of the Wise Way, love, as you can read in the translation of Claudia Ribeiro (2004, 139): I have three treasures What entesouro and retains: The first is love (CI), The second frugality, The third is not daring to be the vanguard of the world. (…) For love, In combat, it triumphs, And in defense it is firm. The sky will come to aid And, with love, will protect (我有三寶/寶而持之/一曰慈/二曰儉/三曰不敢為天下先 (……) 夫慈以戰則勝//以守則固/以慈衛之 1) It is noted that while in proverbial philosophy the synogram used for love is 爱/愛 2 (AI), in the scholarly philosophy of the Patriarch of Taoism the term employment is 慈 (CI), that is, love with a strong relational and spiritual burden; Although they are different words, both refer to love, the first concerns the most physical and concrete feeling, centered on the heart of the person and the clutches that hold it; The second to that most relational and general indicates that love comes from inside the heart (内心 nèixīn), where it has the roots, emerging like any plant. However, the truth is that both terms focus on people, or rather in their hearts, affectionate connection with others, such a strong connection that draws the attention of heaven (天 tiān), maximum impersonal power, it ensures victory on all battle fronts, whether in the forefront or rear, when fighting and defended itself for love. Already the patriarch of Confucianism, Confucius (孔子), in the Chapter Twelve, later entitled the deep face, of the Analects (論語 • 颜渊第十二 ， 22) defines the main virtue of the school, benevolence or humanity, (仁 Rén) as an act of love to others, maintaining the term of the traditional vernacular 爱 (AI): “Fan Chi asked what was the benevolence was what answered, "love people". " (樊遲問仁 ， 子曰 「愛人 3。 ”) It is in this context of love of neighbor, that one of the main maxims of Confucian philosophy must be understood, which arises in the same chapter (論語 • 颜渊第十二 ， 2)“ Do not make the others what they do not want for you ”(己所不欲勿施於人 jǐ suǒ bù yù shunk yú rén). The essentials in Confucian philosophy will then guarantee love of others in terms of respect or humanity towards others, in order to ensure the normal functioning of society, without extreme sacrifices or exaggerated explorations, given to the proverb containment of confusion in relation to feelings, they are important and useful but should not extravate the boundaries of rationality, that is, even the best of them, will have to be measured, controlled and ritualized in the name of harmony collective. Therefore, the love that moves friendships, especially intellectuals, is the most praised, as we remembered at the end of this chapter (論語 • 颜渊第十二 ， 24): Zeng Zi stated: “A gentleman resorts to knowing to make friends and friends to cultivate benevolence4” (曾子曰：君以文會友 ， 以友輔仁。) Finally, also the Buddhist philosophy, especially from the Chan (禅 Chán) or Zen meditation line, praises the love of humanity, but indirectly, drawing attention to the heart and the identification of Buddha with the heart, the way of the Daoxin Patriarch (道信) and its maximum proverbially known “the heart is Buddha and Buddha is the heart” (非心不问佛 ， 问佛不非心 fēi xīn bùwèn fu, wèn fi bù fēi xīn). Here you come to love indirectly, only an enlightened heart can love the Buddha, as it is not surprising in the picture of this philosophy, after all what is Buddha but the very love that expresses itself not in a selfish, sick, self -centered heart, but in a heart capable of establishing relationships, healthy, altruistic and without empty, but not indifferent to the other? This confirms it the social and humanitarian actions of Via Mahayana Buddhism, which was accepted in China and unfolds in collective works such as the construction of educational institutions, hospitals, centers of social solidarity, in a proselytist action at all similar to the history of the Christian Church and its missionaries around the world. item.title: Osaka 2025 | Japanese architect Kengo Kuma considers it to be friendly with architecture
item.description: Japanese architect Kengo Kuma states in an interview with Lusa that she wanted to show the uniqueness between Portugal and Japan in the Portuguese Pavilion project at Expo 2025 Osaka and considers AI (artificial intelligence) friendly to architecture. Asked if Artificial Intelligence (AI) is a friend or enemy of architecture, Kengo Kuma opts for the first option. "Yes, it's a friend", because in fact in the design process "we are working with AI". Artificial intelligence “is a very strong team between us” and “we like to work” with this technology, he says. “We wanted to show the relationship with the ocean in Portugal,” says Kengo Kuma, when asked what was the project's inspiration. Portugal participates in Expo Osaka with the theme “Ocean, Blue Dialogue” and is located in the “Empowering Lives” zone, in a lot with 1,836.75 square meters, being close to the Japan Pavilion. The Kuma Kuma project expresses the dynamics of the ocean moment, using 9,972 suspended cables weighing more than 60 tons, and recycled networks to create a perennial effect and exposed to natural elements such as sun and wind, according to the organization. Sea connections The life of Portugal and Japan is “very linked to the ocean”, in the sense that “we eat fish, we travel a lot through the oceans and history and life are closely linked to the ocean,” adds the architect. There is this “uniqueness of Portugal and Japan and we want to show” this similarity between the two countries. The volume of the Portugal Pavilion is characterized by a scenic facility that symbolizes the upper square suspended as a wave. "This design is very, very new to the history of art. We have long tried to use lines as a resource for navigation. With these lines, we try to show the beauty of natural phenomena," in the sea "we see natural light and breeze," he explains. “We tried to bring this kind of natural phenomenon to the Expo, perhaps the first attempt in the history of the expo to bring its own nature to the pavilion,” says the architect. About what will happen to the pavilion after finishing the Expo, the architect says he wants to bring the diversity of the project (which includes cables of various diameters and lengths) to different places. “I want to bring this diversity to different places” and “now we are planning to work with some artists” about it. Kengo Kuma said that the Slaughterhouse Project in Porto is completing and has two more projects in Portugal. The architect says he loves the side of the big cities in Portugal, but also the mountainous side and the ocean of the country. “We want to enjoy the diversity of Portugal,” he says. Create Memories Asked how can the more sustainable architecture become currently become, Kengo Kuma considers that "the most important for sustainability is to leave the memory of architecture forever." That is, "architecture, life, basically, are not so permanent." However, “we can leave the memory of architecture forever, which is the connection between architecture and humanity” and this “is the most important for sustainability,” he says. Used to comment on the controversy around his choice to project the Portuguese pavilion, the architect points out that he has an international office working in Portugal. "Maybe that's why we were invited," he concludes. Regarding the challenges that architecture currently faces, Kengo Kuma states that its cost is increasing “dramatically” and that everyone wants to reduce it. "But at the same time, people want to create a new monument" for this pillar. "And the cost and monumentality must walk together" today. Expo 2025 runs since April 13 and runs until October 13 on the artificial island of Yumeshima, located on the edge of Osaka, Kansai, Japan.

item.title: Literature | The interest of linguist Hugo Schuchardt in Patuá de Macau
item.description:
Hugo Schuchardt had a genuine interest in Luso-Asian Creole languages, with particular emphasis on Patuá, spoken by the Macanese community. The linguist, who was born in 1842, was the subject of a lecture conducted by researcher Hugo Cardoso, linked to the University of Lisbon
Porto, 1883. José Leite de Vasconcelos writes a letter to the German linguist Hugo Schuchardt who had been developing studies, albeit at a distance, about the languages ​​spoken in Asia originated in Portuguese, the so -called Creoles. The letter, written according to the spell agreement of the time, however digitized and today to keep the Archive of the University of Graz, Austria, comes in the context of Schuchardt's own requests to Vasconcelos Milk on the Creole that was then spoken in Macao, known as Patuá. “My respectable friend: I can only respond to you today. Here in Porto there are no books that say, but I wrote to Lisbon to my friend Vianna and he replied that the Balsmanha does not appear, and that in Macao's story there comes nothing about the dialect port. From Macau. Usual. I have already asked for information about the Creoles, but I have not yet got anything; This study also interests me about regarding Portuguese. I look forward to the 2 new booklets that promises me. (…) Without anymore I am a friend, J. Vasconcelos Leite, Porto, S. Victor, 25 ”. Hugo Schuchardt's interest in Luso-Asian Creole has been studied by Hugo Cardoso, a researcher and professor at the Faculty of Letters of the University of Lisbon (FLUL), a Creole specialist who developed investigation at the University of Macao. The academic recently conducted a lecture at the National Library in Lisbon over the linguist born in Gotha, Germany, in 1842 and died in Graz, Austria, in 1927, being considered one of the most important linguists of the late nineteenth and early twentieth century. The session was called “Hugo Schuchardt and the search for the Luso-Asian Creole”. Despite Schuchardt's interest on Macao's Creole, he did not publish any academic work on the subject, as he told HM Hugo Cardoso. "Schuchardt did not publish any work on Macau. However, when he covered his correspondence, it is clear that Macau was also on his radar, since he discusses the Macao Creole with several of his correspondents, including Vasconcelos milk and Gonçalves Viana," he said. item.title: Church | Victims of sexual abuse want Leo XIV to assume theme
item.description:
One of the movement spokesmen that represents victims of sexual abuse in the Catholic Church yesterday asked Pope Leo XIV to put the theme as a priority and defines global rules to deal with cases. "Now that we have a new Latin American Pope should be given an example in all Latin American episcopades that, by decision and by the Pope, there can be no double standard" among the various Catholic hierarchies around the world, "said Argentine Sebastián Cuattromo, from the adult collective for the rights of the child. On the day the Pope made the first Sunday greeting in St. Peter's Square, praying Regina Caeli, a group of victims joined the square to ask the Vatican to impose common rules on the whole church. Cuattromo, 42, set an example of what is happening "in the first world societies and Latin America that acts as a Vatican backyard, where the same [repair] demands are not felt, such as they are felt before European public opinion." "As a survivor of childhood sexual abuse within the Catholic Church, with other companions survivors of this crime, we hope that the Pope will make an explicit mention of this question and an explicit reference to what he intends to do about it to pay off very large debts that, in our opinion, the Catholic Church still has to the victims," ​​said Cuattromo. “We victims broke the taboo, silence, denial, concealment, with our struggles, with a huge sacrifice, and reached a level of visibility in public opinion,” which forced the church to face the problem. Therefore, the global group of victims subscribed to a petition already delivered, in which they require “a true zero tolerance law that is established as canonical law”, which would “imply the immediate expulsion of the religious life of anyone involved in these acts”. Moreover, they propose a “Truth Commission that should not be directed by the Vatican, but by international human rights organizations with the United Nations standards and with which the Vatican would have to fully cooperate, freeing all the archives he has on the subject”. Finally, the victims intend a “justice process for the victims, where, among other things, there are concrete actions of reparation and justice for survivors around the world”, with the costs supported by the Church's own goods.
In the first person In his particular case, Sebastian Cuattromo filed an action against a religious from a Catholic school of Buenos Aires for sexual abuse and won the process in 2012, even before the election to the Pope of then Cardinal Bergoglio, archbishop of the Argentine capital. "Then the city's Catholic hierarchy was against the victims and supported the school, which intended to silence the victims of this offense through a private economic agreement," he recalled. "They made us feel a profound underestimation of the severity of the crime we were talking about," because, at that moment, "I was a young man who was fighting in solitude, with many doubts, with a lot less, with much anguish and felt an absolute lack of empathy and, instead, deep arrogance," he explained. After Francis' election, "I invited him publicly and privately to meet with the victims of his country, especially those who had bad experiences," but the Pope "never had the courage or sensitivity of calling us." For the new Pope, who is also accused of having ignored abuse complaints when he was a prior of the Augustinhos, Cuattromo expects Leo XIV to “assume this theme personally” and to be willing to “go to the last consequences”. Cardinal Robert Francis Prevost, 69, was elected Pope on Thursday, after two days of Conclave, in the Vatican City, and took the name of Leo XIV.

item.title: PME | Events promoted by Melco generated $ 1 million
item.description:
Melco Resorts claims to have generated about $ 1 million for small and medium -sized local businesses through events promoted last year. In the 2024 sustainability report, the game operator also highlights the results in terms of waste management and energy spending
The Melco Resorts & Entertainment Sustainability Report has just been published last year, which highlights the gains obtained by small and medium -sized (SMEs) with the events promoted by the operator. With regard to the “community engagement and investment” part, it is read that “more than $ 1.02 million for local companies and [NGO] non-governmental organizations in Macao through 21 SME events, with 603 SME and NGO participants” were generated. In addition, in the volunteering area, Melco points out that "about 3,600 participants offered their time and effort in more than 359 volunteering initiatives," "more than $ 17.42 million that were donated to decent causes in our communities." Quoted by the report, Lawrence Ho, Melco's president and executive director, says that "21 Heart of House initiatives and community events have generated more than $ 1 million for local companies in Macao, providing 603 SMEs and NGO opportunities to connect, expand and grow." According to the official, last year were "in -depth partnerships with PME and NGO". Regarding the relationship with local SMEs, Melco also highlights the connection with the supply chain, because “86 percent of acquisitions arose from local companies in Macao”, and of this total, “59 percent were local SME acquisitions”. Similar scenario occurred in the other operators that Melco holds in Cyprus and Manila, with local acquisitions around 40 and 76 percent, respectively. Regarding the company's training actions, Melco says it has invested on average "582 US dollars per full -time worker in learning and development activities, which is equivalent to an average of 38 hours of training." In this context, “100 percent of colleagues participated in training actions”, can be read. In addition, "over 758,000 participants have attended more than 1,400 courses offered by" Melco Learning Academy ", which is equivalent to over 870,000 hours of learning." Also noteworthy is that, in all Melco projects, "women represent 23 percent of the boards of business and 32 percent of the higher paintings." The report also tells that “63 percent of positions at the vice-presidency level, or above this post, were filled from local communities, increasing to 70 percent in Macao”, can read. All for the environment Another of the areas highlighted in Melco's sustainability report concerns environmental policies. One of the areas that is “in progress” is the energy consumption, in order to obtain more reasonableness of consumption. "In 2024, despite an increase of 39 percent in terms of the number of visitors and the rise of 19 percent in the occupation rate of the hotel rooms, along with the addition of a property and a new resort integrated into our portfolio, the energy intensity increased by 10 percent from 2023, but was 19 percent lower than our year of reference 2019." One of the “achieved” objectives is the energy efficiency measures, which “since 2018 has resulted in an annualized savings of more than 62.5 million kWh, an increase of 9 percent compared to 2023”. Another "achieved" goal concerns the installation of "over 25,000 photovoltaic panels on all properties in Macau, Manila and Cyprus, generating about 10,000 kWh annually." Thus, in the properties of Melco "the electricity consumption from renewable sources increased by 72 percent compared to 2023". Regarding the group's means of transportation, “buses, electric and hybrid vehicles represent 55 percent of our combined fleet, with loading stations, an increase of 25 percent compared to 2023”. In terms of materials and waste management, Melco says it has avoided plastic spending in the order of 13.2 million bottles, thanks to the installation of “the Nordaq water filtering system that serves almost every hotel rooms in Melco Integrated Resorts”. In addition, the example of the City of Dreams venture in Manila is presented where “a circular economy system was established in which food waste is decomposed on site, and the excess donated to a local fifth to cultivate some of the vegetables served to guests”. In terms of water consumption, the report indicates that “despite the increase in the number of visitors and the hotel occupancy rate”, “total water consumption and water intensity increased only 6 and 2 percent compared to 2023, respectively, and were 6 and 30 percent lower, respectively, to the 2019 reference year”. However, this is a goal that, according to the company, is still "in progress". Another objective highlighted in the report was the “annual economy of over 510,820 cubic meters of water through water efficiency measures, an increase of 10 percent compared to 2023. "As we invest in people and communities, we continue to derive environmental efforts with the same determination. (…) The intensity of energy and water consumption, as well as greenhouse gas emissions, remained significantly below our 2019 base line, even adding a new property and an integrated resort," says Lawrence Ho. The entrepreneur also referred to the increase "of the amount of valuable materials diverted through recycling and composting in global operations - 58 percent over last year." “In our restoration spaces we also fight food waste, with the 'clean dish challenge' to contribute to a 9 percent reduction in waste in the Macao and Manila restoration areas.” “Mentality change” For Lawrence Ho, greater sustainability in Melco requires "a change of mindset" verified in "small actions that, on scale, can have a significant impact." Regarding the supply chain of the group's integrated hotels and resorts, good results are also highlighted. "Although the numbers do not always show exponential heels, our focus on responsible supply remains unwavering, 18 percent of all seafood bought by weight to be sustainable sources, and 100 percent of our food and drink points in Macao and Manila to serve eggs of outdoor chickens," he reads. There is thus "an effort that reflects a deeper ambition to incorporate sustainability into acquisitions," said Lawrence Ho, who added that "more than one service, hospitality has to do with the experience it creates, the people it supports and the impact it leaves." “Every year, Melco challenges himself to go further, believing that luxury and responsibility are not opposite forces, but partners in progress, which is reflected in the way we defend strong governance, we manage our environmental impact, we support our people and communities and lead the responsible game. This commitment to progress shaped our approach in 2024, as a year of recalibration in which we continue to strengthen operations, operations, rekindle the impetus and ensure that our integrated resorts remain at the forefront of excellence, ”he concluded.

item.title: Blackout | Normality resumed yesterday, it still causes because it
item.description:
The week has started atypically on the Iberian Peninsula. It was a few minutes from 11:30 am on Monday, when a widespread electricity failure paralyzed Portugal and Spain. Only near 23h the light returned to the Portuguese house, but the dropper
It was an apparent normal Monday, but this normality dissipated late in the morning with the electricity failure that gradually led to communication failures and impossibility of using mobile data. Portugal and Spain were without electricity for too many hours on Monday, an unprecedented episode in terms of energy failures. In the case of Lisbon, the light began to fail a few minutes after 11:30 am, followed by the impossibility of communication via mobile data. Traffic in the center of the Portuguese capital became chaotic, without traffic lights in operation, generating some road accidents. Supermarkets, cafes and restaurants, with no possibility of maintaining normal operation and food properly refrigerated, closed doors. Many people, frightened by the possibility of staying several days without light, ran to supermarkets, sagging canned foods, water carboys, candles and batteries. In addition to the unusual constraints in people's daily lives, with the suddenly closed meter and congested transport, there were suspended flights and closed airports. The restoration of energy took place gradually throughout Monday, starting with the Center of Portugal. The circulation in the Lisbon Metropolitan (ML) was resumed at all at 08:38, Lisbon time, first in the blue and red lines at 08h, in yellow at 08:15 and green at 08:38. "The Lisbon Metropolitano had a vast team working yesterday night [Monday] and today's dawn [Tuesday] to ensure the replacement of operating systems affected by the widespread energy failure yesterday," ML said in a statement. Government words In a note issued by the Portuguese government in the early hours of yesterday morning, it was said that there were already “virtually all services, including the supply of energy, restored,” Presidential Minister António Leitão Amaro told Lusa. According to the minister, all 6.4 million customers had access to electricity in the early hours of Tuesday morning, except 800 who had faults not related to the blackout. Leitão Amaro also said that water supply is working throughout the country, with only a few pressure difficulties in "two or three municipalities" that will be "resolved quickly". Regarding transportation, the minister said that the "trains are working", and it is still necessary to stabilize some points of the operation, but due to the effects of 24 hours strike that took place on Monday. About airports, “are operational,” said Leitão Amaro, recognizing that in the case of Lisbon airport, which was the most affected by energy failure and should take two days [to this day] to have stabilized flows, although the systems are all operational. Normalized Schools and Health The Portuguese ruler also said that, in relation to schools, the guidance issued at dawn to all directors was to open and function normally, except for cases where there may be some specific security ratio. "The supply of fuels is normalized and did not record, at night, relevant occurrences of security or civil protection" in the country, advanced Leitão Amaro, stressing that the situation is also stabilized in health services. "Hospitals and health centers are in terms of supply and supply to function normally," he said. "Right now, what we can say is that [energy] systems are stabilized, both in transportation and consumers supply," said the presidency minister. In Spain there were also several embarrassment, especially at the level of transport. Pedro Sánchez, Spanish Prime Minister, said on Monday, quoted by Lusa, that this episode was unprecedented in the country. The ruler spoke to the country after the second meeting of Spain National Security Council. "All potential causes are analyzed without discarding any hypothesis," he added. Gigawatts loss The Spanish government leader revealed that, according to the technicians and experts of the Spanish power grid, 15 generation gigawatts "suddenly lost the system in just five seconds, something that had never happened." According to explained, to give a dimension of the event, 15 kilowatts of generation correspond to approximately looking for total electricity in the country at the time of blackout (12:33 in Spain, 11h33 in Lisbon). "What has caused this sudden disappearance of supply" is something that experts cannot yet explain, he added. In the early hours after the blackout, information began to circulate on a possible cyberathel who never confirmed. A few hours after the blackout, Ursula Von Der Leyen, president of the European Commission, said on the LinkedIn social network that he had spoken with the prime ministers Pedro Sánchez and Luís Montenegro about the monitoring of the case. “I reaffirmed that the European Commission has supported and monitored the situation with national and European authorities and together with our electricity coordination group. We will gather efforts and share information to help restore the electricity supply system, agreeing to maintain narrow contact,” reads one of the publications. Eduardo Prieto, head of operations at Spanish Red Electric, told the Associated Press that the situation was not preceded by something “exceptional and extraordinary”. One of the possible causes pointed to the blackout is a rare atmospheric phenomenon, referred to as “induced atmospheric vibration”, which may have originated “anomalous oscillations” in the high voltage lines of the Spanish energy network. "These oscillations have caused synchronization failures between electrical systems, leading to successive disturbances in interconnected European networks," the Portuguese Energy company Ren to BBC told Monday afternoon. But later Ren denied this information. Many issues Another causes may have been technical problems in the electric network itself. Onyema NDUKA, a full -sustainability professor of energy sustainability at the University of London, said electric networks are usually interconnected because the production centers that feed them are located far from cities. This means that a power cut in a part of the grid can "lead to a waterfall effect in other areas." "Ideally, redundancies are incorporated into the system, such as having several supply points, reserve generators located in different locations, wires and interconnected cables, etc.," he said. The solution is through energy companies to restore electricity to affected customers as soon as possible, but the procedure for doing so “has not yet been revealed,” added NDUKA. The Portuguese authorities, cited by the AP and the local media, have so far attributed the failure of energy to unspecified technical problems, originating outside the country, but said that the investigation is still underway. The possibility of a cyberatoque is, for now, away. “Spain has mechanisms to deal with this kind of situations. Once again, I appeal to citizens to collaborate with all authorities and act responsibly and civilly, as we have always done,” wrote Pedro Sánchez on social networks. The Portuguese National Cyberrseness Center also stated in a statement that there is no evidence that the failure was caused by a computer attack. Speaking to Euronews, Taco Engelaar, Neara Director-General, a specialist in energy infrastructure, said the interconnectivity of national networks and their systems would mean that a failure or attack would have the same net result. "Such a widespread failure of the network is extremely unusual and can be caused by a number of factors: a physical failure on the network that provokes the power cut, a coordinated cybercar or a dramatic imbalance between demand and the supply that has made the network system exceeds the boundaries," he said. "If it is a system failure, then the interconnectivity between the different regional and national networks can lead to the large amount of power cuts we are watching today [Monday]," he added. "The same applies to a cybership - many of these systems are linked and sharing assets - to overthrow one can overthrow many," he said. With agencies

item.title: AL | Xia says that relationship with executive differs from separation of powers
item.description:
At a meeting with the deputies, the Director of the Office for Hong Kong and Macao affairs to the Council of State stated that the relationship between the Executive and the Legislative Assembly is different from the concept of separation of powers from the “West”. Xia Baolong characterized the relationship as a collaboration with the predominance of the executive branch
Hong Kong and Macau's workst a director of the China Communist Party Central Committee and Director of the Hong Kong and Macau Affairs Office with the Council of State, Xia Baolong, went to the Legislative Assembly (AL) on Sunday for an ideas exchange with all the plenary deputies. During the meeting, Xia Baolong will have stated that "the way basic law regulates the relationship between the executive and legislative powers is not the same relationship that exists in the separation of powers used by the" West "," said the president of AL. Since the beginning of his passage through Macao, and like previous visits, Xia Baolong is quoted by guardians of high government positions and, in this case, by Kou Hoi In and some deputies. In statements cited by the Chinese channel of Rádio Macau, the president of AL indicated that Xia Baolong had binded the government's ancestry in relation to the House of Laws. “[The Director] said we have to further reinforce and optimize the relationship between the executive and legislative powers. The two parties need respect and mutual support so that we can benefit and develop the particularity of our political system to be characterized by the predominance of the executive power,” said Kou Hoi In. It should be noted that in no article of the basic law of the MSAR, or even the annex that regulates the methodology for the constitution of the AL, the predominance of the Executive Power is indicated in the face of the Legislative Power. In fact, Article 71 of the Basic Law establishes the possibility of the Legislative Assembly approving a motion of censorship “accusing the chief executive of serious violation of the law or abandonment of his duties”. In addition, despite having powers to dissolve the Legislative Assembly, article 54 of the Basic Law indicates two situations of conflict with the Legislative Power that may result in the resignation of the position of the Chief Executive. Roll During the meeting with the deputies, Xia Baolong praised the legislative work, in particular the revisions of laws related to national security, electoral laws and the legislation related to the game sector. Cooperation with Hengqin was one of the most discussed topics, with deputies and the director to agree on the need to reinforce integration between the two territories. The director pointed out that it is necessary to be aware and prepared “for adversities, do the work of accelerating hengqin-macau integration and the proper diversification of the economy of Macao, and take another step in optimizing the relationship between executive branch and legislative power, in the sense of respect and mutual support, to enhance the institutional advantages of the predominance of the executive branch. Firstly, the need to have a spirit of struggle and face the current geopolitical situation at a higher level. Xia Baolong also asked entrepreneurs to have confidence in medium and long term national plans and tell the stories of China, Hong Kong and Macao well. item.title: TNR | Government refuses proportion to “unwanted work”
item.description:

The government does not consider it “appropriate to rigidly establish a proportion to the number of resident or non-resident workers to hire by the companies, namely for jobs that few residents want to exercise,” said the director of services for Labor Affairs (DSAL), Chan Un Tong, in response to written Song Pek Kei interplies. The deputy linked to the Fujian community warned of the “many front line jobs sought by residents and licenses”, which are eventually performed by non-resident workers ”(TNR) in game, tourism and leisure companies. However, the director of Dsal states that “a more flexible and pragmatic adjustment in the appreciation of TNR requests”, “in articulation with the creation of the Macao World Tourism and Leisure Center, as well as the needs of socioeconomic development”. In this sense, Chan Un Tong stresses that the fundamental principle of labor imports "is to ensure that resident workers have priority in access to employment and that their work rights and interests are not injured." The DSAL Director indicates that in all circumstances, provided that there are interested residents that fulfill the requirements for position performance, companies should always give priority to their hiring. Fair Days One of the central points of the written interpellation of Deputy Song Pek Kei was the difficulty in entering the labor market felt by newly elders. The director of DSAL responded with numbers. In the first quarter of this year, 2,570 employment candidates were "hired through the measures of support for the employment of DSAL, of which, about 50 percent were young people aged 34 or less." Among the pairing events, or hiring plans for tourism and leisure companies, Chan Un Tong stressed the “Young Employment Fair”, which takes place at the end of the school year to attract college students to participate in job interviews. At the same time, the direction of subsistence services services in the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Hengqin has moved to Chinese higher education institutions where you are younger in Macao to promote internship and learning plans of Macau, Hengqin and other provinces and inland cities.

item.title: Employment | Leong Sun Iok warns of collecting candidate information
item.description:
Leong Sun IOK warns of the increase of companies that research the past of job candidates and argues that the information obtained by former employers is often skewed and unfair. The deputy calls for regulation to the government
Deputy Leong Sun IOK intends that the government regulates the collection of information carried out by companies on employment candidates. The request is contained in a written interpellation, in which the legislator linked to the Federation of Macao Workers Associations (Faom) warns of the occurrence of various illegalities, without any consequences. According to the scenario outlined by Leong Sun Iok, when applying for a job, especially through online platforms, interested parties are led to sign forms and to consent that entities research their past. However, the deputy warns that the practice is illegitimate, uncommon, allowing the creation of informal black lists and the exchange of information between companies. This situation can result in the blocking of job opportunities for former employees who have had different employer entities. "It is a practice that blocks access to employment in an industry, which seriously undermines the right to employment," says the legislator. Leong Sun Iok also reveals that “over the years he has received a high number of requests and assistance” from people faced from one of the six game dealers and that they have later seen themselves. "Some people who asked me for help told me that they were convinced by supervisors to say goodbye. And if they did not say goodbye to their initiative, they were threatened that they would never find employment in the industry again. All these cases reflect the damage caused by collecting information without any regulation," added the deputy. However, the practice is not limited to this sector: "In addition to the game dealers, there are a high number of companies in Macao that also requires employment candidates to allow their past to be investigated," he said. Against the law Leong Sun IOK also points out that the Labor Relations Law and Decree-Law 101/84/M define that former expirers when issuing a proof of work to a former worker cannot make any unfavorable reference to its past. However, the deputy indicates that the current, even informal practice, contradicts the spirit of the law, ending up being more harmful, because the former employee has no control over information that may not even be true. "As the verification process lacks transparency and is not controlled by the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs, it is unfair to employment candidates and can violate the principle of good faith in labor relations," he warns. "How will management regulate information about professional background? It is possible to issue guidelines and change the law to explicitly stipulate that former employers should in no way transmit, make statements or adopt unfavorable behaviors to workers?"

item.title: Hong Kong Queen's College's cadabulas
item.description:
Last April, during the Unified History Test of China at the Hong Kong Queen's College, several students from one of the classes copied. They shouted the answers to each other, consulted the books and the iPads. The vigilante tried several times to stop them, but failed. The board of the college said that it will only punish prevariculars students according to internal rules. The college also notified parents about this incident, saying that as only a month left for final exams and, to avoid unnecessary pressures about the students, the test will not be repeated. The results of the China Unified History Test of this class will be canceled and the classification to this discipline will depend on the final exam. For the other classes, the classification of China's History discipline will take into account the results of the unified test and the final exam. Students often happen to copy the tests. With new technologies, the tools that allow them to “make cheats” change every day. From traditional paper rackets to intelligent devices, the evolution of these tools reflects the erosion of academic integrity through the abuse of technology. In the past, the students wrote the answers to pieces of paper, commonly known to rabids, and took them to the exam room; Or asked to go to the bathroom and so they consulted the materials. With the popularization of intelligent clocks, real -time concerted communication functions allow remotely online cabular. If the vigilante is not aware, students can use smart watches for this purpose while sitting in their places. Real -time -time translation functions have recently appeared that can directly convert English to Chinese texts. The constant evolution of these tools makes the work of vigilantes increasingly difficult. To get a thief, we need evidence. To get a gussy student, you also have to have tests. However, for vigilantes, it is always very difficult to obtain these evidence; If they can't prove that the student copied, it is complicated to accuse him. In the case of the "Cada on paper", the student can swallow or hide it as they are being exposed, or argue with the vigilante and refuse to deliver the rabula. Teachers are not police officers and are not entitled to review students, so several "jams" escape unpunished for lack of tests and naturally cannot be accused. These cases, to some extent, lead other students to risk. There is certainly no lack of diligent students, scholars and workers in an exam room. When these students discover the colleagues' strokes, they can choose to report them, but if they do the most likely it is to be ostracized and subject to intimidation. In addition, the highly stressful exam environment makes most students focus on their own answers, and have no time or energy to observe others. Therefore, the reports of colleagues represent a small percentage and the exposure of these cases depends on the vigilantes to be committed and want to discover the offenders. Copy, use fake certificates and plagiarize are all academic violations of the same nature - dishonesty and bad practices. In recent years, it is not difficult to find these cases in the news. Having this incident in one of Hong Kong's oldest elite colleges, reflects not only the moral deviation of the students, but also the distortion of learning values. The more students make glow, the greater the change of values ​​and the less they will study hard. The “elite” group created by false achievements may seem knowledgeable, but in fact is devoid of value and will eventually expose their lack of knowledge in their areas in the future. Just think: Can a doctor without skills treat a patient? Can a lawyer defend the client without knowing the law? This hidden danger is like a clock pump. Its destructive power continues to manifest in the next decade or even later, and finally the whole society will pay its price. We have to stop this problem. Schools have to take proper measures, prescribe the right medicine, improve situations that give it azo and cultivate the correct values ​​in students. Containing the jar requires multi-dimensional efforts. Firstly, students who copy should be severely punished and this behavior cannot be tolerated. Schools must have rules for dealing with unusual behaviors. For example, if at least two vigilantes see a student swallowing papers, it should be disqualified from the exam. After the punishment must be re -educated. Schools must have subjects that deal with academic integrity and compulsory courses that shape the values ​​of learning. It is necessary to make students understand that a grade of 60 is not shameful, but it is vital that they realize that a false 100 has to be punished. Since this pedagogical idea becomes consensual, society will no longer judge heroes by their grades, students will be able to maintain their moral values ​​and the entrepreneurial spirit of “knowing shame and then learning to be brave” will reappear. Only after stressing the importance of identifying the “real value” of students can education return to its original purpose of “teaching and sharing knowledge”, the reasons that lead to glow can decrease and the promotion of talented people will no longer be a game that compares large and small number.
